subject: Gardening
title: The New Perennial Movement
description: A quick win: understand The New Perennial Movement.

hook.text: Piet Oudolf designs gardens that look beautiful dead. Seed heads and dried stems are part of the winter display.

buildup.text: The movement uses ornamental grasses and hardy perennials in naturalistic drifts inspired by wild communities.

discovery.text: Oudolf's High Line turned an abandoned NYC railway into an urban meadowâ€”the world's most famous perennial garden.

twist.text: These gardens look wild but are intensely designed. Every plant is precisely placed to create controlled naturalism.

climax.text: The New Perennial Movement proves that beauty exists in decay, structure, and seasonalityâ€”not just in peak bloom.

punchline.text: Oudolf designs gardens to look beautiful when they're dead.

quiz.question: What makes the New Perennial Movement different from traditional garden design?
options: It uses only annual flowers that bloom all season long
It embraces dead seed heads and dried stems as part of the design display
It prohibits the use of any ornamental grasses in planting schemes
